title: What Does the âœ‹ Hand Emoji Mean?

steps.title: The hand emoji can mean "Stop!"
steps.content: The hand emoji can mean "Stop!" Picture a crossing guard holding up their hand to keep someone from crossing the street. Over text, it means to stop talking or to be quiet. Itâ€™s less of a command and more of a joke (emojis are meant to be fun!). [1] X Research source â€œOk thatâ€™s enough out of you âœ‹â€ â€œNope! âœ‹ Donâ€™t go there lolâ€

steps.title: People also use the hand emoji to say "I agree."
steps.content: People also use the hand emoji to say "I agree." All in favor, raise your hand. In a group chat setting, someone might send the âœ‹ emoji to show they agree with what someone said. It can also mean â€œmeâ€ in response to a question like â€œWhoâ€™s coming?â€ or â€œWho's in?â€ [2] X Research source â€œâœ‹ I second what she said!â€ â€œIâ€™m in! âœ‹â€

steps.title: The hand emoji also means "I have a question."
steps.content: The hand emoji also means "I have a question." Not sure what's going on? Use âœ‹ to signal that you have a question, just like how you raised your hand in school to ask the teacher something. This occurs most frequently in group chats or on video meeting platforms like Zoom, where you can let the host know you have a question without interrupting. [3] X Research source â€œAhem âœ‹â€ â€œâœ‹ Hold up, I have a questionâ€

steps.title: The hand emoji can be a High 5!
steps.content: The hand emoji can be a High 5! This open-palmed emoji could also symbolize one half of a High 5. Look to see if itâ€™s paired with a compliment or a positive exclamation. [4] X Research source â€œNice job today! âœ‹â€ â€œWE WON! âœ‹â€

steps.title: The hand emoji is a way to say "Hey there!"
steps.content: The hand emoji is a way to say "Hey there!" âœ‹ symbolizes someone waving hello or goodbye. This is the case if itâ€™s paired with a greeting or salutation. â€œHi Sarah! âœ‹â€ â€œSee you tomorrow âœ‹â€

steps.title: Tell someone to "Talk to the hand" with the âœ‹ emoji.
steps.content: Tell someone to "Talk to the hand" with the âœ‹ emoji. Because the face donâ€™t wanna hear it! Send âœ‹ when you want to playfully nudge someone to stop talking or change the subject. [5] X Research source Remember, emojis are lighthearted. If you urgently need someone to zip their lips, just say so (without an emoji). â€œâœ‹ Iâ€™m not going there right now lolâ€ â€œDonâ€™t start! âœ‹â€

steps.title: Say "Aye!" with the hand emoji when youâ€™re in favor of something.
steps.content: Say "Aye!" with the hand emoji when youâ€™re in favor of something. Display your agreement to the whole group chat or everyone in the comments section of a post. Send âœ‹ to show you agree with what someone said, you volunteer for something, or that they can count on you. â€œIâ€™ll be there! âœ‹â€ â€œâœ‹ Pick me! I volunteer!â€

steps.title: Raise your hand emoji to say "Hold on, I have a question."
steps.content: Raise your hand emoji to say "Hold on, I have a question." Send a raised hand when you need to clarify something or youâ€™re confused. You can pair it with your question, or add a few question marks to indicate you want to be â€œcalled on.â€ â€œâœ‹ So what time are we leaving?â€ â€œâœ‹??â€

steps.title: Tell someone "Awesome job!" with the âœ‹ emoji.
steps.content: Tell someone "Awesome job!" with the âœ‹ emoji. Initiate or reciprocate a virtual High 5 with someone. Add âœ‹ to a compliment to show you recognize someoneâ€™s achievement, or just use it because youâ€™re excited! â€œWeâ€™re gonna kill it on stage tonight! âœ‹â€ â€œâœ‹ Right back atcha!â€

steps.title: Use the hand emoji to say "See ya!"
steps.content: Use the hand emoji to say "See ya!" Use âœ‹ to wave hello when you open a conversation or to say â€œbyeâ€ when youâ€™re wrapping up. Send it first, or use it to reciprocate someoneâ€™s virtual wave. â€œGood morning! âœ‹â€ â€œNice talking to you too. Have a great night! âœ‹â€

steps.title: Need to switch things up?
steps.content: Need to switch things up? There are a ton of hand emojis you can choose from to communicate the ideas that âœ‹ represents.
